title: Make Location Signed Warning Text more Specific on MN Contracts
custom_steps:
When an Addendum H is not added to an MN Contract, there is a soft error for missing Country and State (if applicable) fields. Currently, the warning reads: There are missing location entries in the Execution of Contract.

Update the warning text to say: There is a missing Country and/or State entry in the Execution of Contract.

title: CLONE - Link WBCP Notifications with the WBC EBIS Email Utility
custom_steps: Allow users to subscribe to wbc notifications from the ebis email utility

title: Updates to Investigation Request Form
custom_steps:
Please add the following attachment labels:

* Venezuelan Government Form - Father
* Venezuelan Government Form - Mother

Please update the text on the Attached File(s) section to:

* In order to request an investigation, you must upload a completed investigation form, the player's birth certificate, a color headshot, the applicable consent form, the mother's ID, the father's ID, and a Venezuelan government form for each parent (for Venezuelan minors).
As a reminder, all signatures must be completed physically with pen and paper.

Please update the text on the Missing File(s) section to:

* If you do not have a copy of the player's ID, the mother's ID, the father's ID, or Venezuelan government forms (if applicable), you must provide an explanation for the absence of the document below. Please upload any supporting documentation, such as a death certificate, in the section above.Â (edited)Â

title: As a MNC Admin, I want to see a Last Updated TS on the MN Payroll Utility
custom_steps:
AC:

* In the Org Summary section of the MN Payroll screen, there will be a new â€œLast Updatedâ€� column to the far right
** This will be the max (most recent) Last Updated date of all that Orgâ€™s players
** This column will be visible to both BOC and Club users
** It will formatted as MM/DD/YYYY
* In the Player Summary section, of the MN Payroll screen, there will be a new â€œLast Updatedâ€� column to the far right
** This will be the max (most recent) Last Updated date for that player

title: As a MNC Admin, I want players signed to the Complex League after the season ends to be credited with a contract year
custom_steps: Players signed to the Complex League after the conclusion of the CL Season and before the last day of the AAA Postseason, will be credited with a contract year.

title: Update MN UPC Boiler Plate Language
custom_steps: Update language in both English and Spanish. See attached:

title: SPIKE: Investigate Vertx replacement
custom_steps: Vertx is used by EBIS but not other products at MLB.  Need to consider if there are equivalent solutions that are used / understood better.  Possibly try a replacement for Rule 5 first and try it out there.

title: SPIKE: Websocket/XHR connections during Draft
custom_steps:
During the Draft, we were seeing about 2-3 users per day at some point start hitting the eventbus xhr endpoints, indicating that their websocket connection failed and they are now using the XHR fallback.

2 potential actions to take here: 1. better understand why/when websocket connections fail and the retry mechanism, 2. make xhr flow more resilient and fix 404 / constant reconnect issue.

title: Prevent BData from receiving picks on API during Prod mocks
custom_steps:
There are times when we want to run a mock draft in Production after the BData team has turned their listener on, so we donâ€™t want them to see picks on the API, but we/BOC do want to see the picks.  BDataâ€™s user account is in the â€œUnassignedâ€� org but this org still sees all Production picks on the API, whether in mock mode or not.  We need to decide how we want to address this.

We will add a new RULE4-MOCK-API-VIEWER permission which will be checked for all picks going out when a mock is running.  Permission will not be a part of any role and will need to be manually added to anyone who needs it (and will not be granted to anyone to start)

title: Add option to prevent drafting non-BOC players/non-redrafts in mock mode in Prod
custom_steps: During the Club mock draft in Production, we instruct users to only draft BOC players or redrafts, but sometimes Clubs donâ€™t realize that they are drafting Club-only players.  On mock draft startup in Prod, we should give an option to allow/disallow Clubs to pick Club-only players.  Thereâ€™s a similar setting on the Draft Test Picker in lower environments.

title: As an EBIS User, I want to be able to export Tx from the Bulk Transfers widget
custom_steps:
AC:

* To the far right of each row on the Bulk Transfers widget will be a â€œPrintâ€� button that will become clickable upon all required fields being filled in
* Selecting to Print will work exactly as regular Transfer Transactions:
** Export a Notice of Disposition as a PDF file with all of the relevant information filled in
* Example Attached

title: As an EBIS User, I want to be able to Transfer Players using the Bulk Transfers widget
custom_steps:
AC:

* Here are the actions of the columns on the widget:
** Org
*** Editable by BOC Only
*** Autofilled/Not editable for Club users
*** Dropdown
** Player
*** Search Bar
**** Only players of the selected Org can populate
**** Upon searching and selecting a player, the Player ID, Pos, and Current Club columns will autofill with the playerâ€™s information
*** Required
** Player ID
*** Autofilled from Player
*** Not editable
** Pos
*** Autofilled from Player
*** Not editable
** Roster Status
*** Autofilled from Player
*** Not editable
** Current Club
*** Autofilled from Player
*** If a player is currently pending to be on a club, autofill the pending club in green text
*** Not editable
** Transfer To
*** Dropdown
*** Population: All MJ & MN Clubs within the selected Org excluding the Current Club
*** Required
** Assignment Date
*** Calendar selection
*** Default to todayâ€™s date
*** Required
** Authorized Signatory
*** Dropdown
*** Population: All known auth sigs for the selected Org
**** Default: None
* Users will be able to add multiple rows of players on the widget for bulk transfers
* At the bottom of the widget, there will be a â€œSubmitâ€� button
* After selecting to â€œSubmit,â€� the rows will disappear from the widget
** After submitting, the system should run rule checks for the selected player and surface any errors/warnings that may block the transfer from being successfully completed
* On the backend, save each row as it is edited on the widget

title: As an EBIS User, I want a new "Bulk Transfers" widget
custom_steps:
Data Discovery: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3921674309/Data+Discovery+-+Bulk+Transfers+Widget|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3921674309/Data+Discovery+-+Bulk+Transfers+Widget|smart-link] 

AC:

* There will be a new tab on the Rosters dashboard called â€œRoster Detailsâ€�
* On the screen, will be a new widget labeled â€œBulk Transfersâ€�
* This new widget will be a blank widget by default
* The table should have the following columns:
** Org
** Player
** Player ID
** Pos
** Roster Status
** Current Club
** Transfer To
** Assignment Date
** Authorized Signatory
* At the bottom right of the Bulk Transfers widget, there will be an â€œAdd Rowâ€� button
* Selecting this button will prompt a new row to appear
* There should be a trashcan icon on the far left of each row to delete the row if needed

title: INC0220594: As a MNC Admin, I want Clubs allowed to outright players without an active MNC after the season ends
custom_steps:
Rule 6.23: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788774/6.+Major+Minor+Outright|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788774/6.+Major+Minor+Outright|smart-link] 

Context: Currently, Clubs are blocked from Outrighting players if they do not have an active MNC.  This hard error should be turned to a soft warning after the conclusion of the MN Season.

AC:

* If a Club submits an Outright tx for a player after the â€œTo Clubâ€™sâ€� MN Season has ended, the resulting message will be a soft error.
** â€œThis transaction may only be performed on a player with an active Minor League Contract.â€�
* After the Rule 5 Date, the message will return to be a hard error
** Existing logic: after the Rule 5 Date, the rule check begins looking at the following year for a MNC
